info.title: Telldus
info.description: This is the telldus API to manage your tellstick live device to manage your devices and turn on and off lights from the web.

get.description: Returns informaiton about a specific client

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Reserved for future use

parameters.name: extras
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned client. Currently supported fields are: coordinate, timezone and tzoffset

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the client

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: An optional uuid for a client. By specifying the uuid, info about a non registered client can be fetched

get.description: Register an unregistered client to the calling user

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This is an unique id for the client

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: The specific clients uuid

get.description: Removes a client from the user. The client needs to be activated again in order to be used

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This is an unique id for the client

get.description: Renames a client

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the client

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name

get.description: Returns a list of all clients associated with the current user

parameters.name: extras
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned client. Currently supported fields are: coordinate, timezone and tzoffset

get.description: Adds a new device and connects it to a client. The client must be editable for this to work
Sends bell command to devices supporting this.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The device id to chime.

get.description: Sends a command to a device

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the device to turn off

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: This should be any of the method constants

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: For command where a value is needed, this is the value

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The device id to dim.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The level the device should dim to. This value should be 0-255

get.description: Sends a "down" command to devices supporting this.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The device id to send the command to

get.description: Returns information about a specific device

parameters.name: extras
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned device. Currently supported fields are: coordinate, timezone and tzoffset

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the device

parameters.name: supportedMethods
parameters.description: The methods supported by the calling application

get.description: Sends a special learn command to some devices that need a special learn-command to be used from TellStick

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The device id to learn.

get.description: Removes a device. It is only possible to remove editable devices.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the device

get.description: Set device model

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the device

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The new model

get.description: Renames a device

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the device

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name

get.description: Set a device parameter

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the device

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Parameter name

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Parameter value

get.description: Set device protocol

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the device

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The new protocol name

get.description: Send a "stop" command to device.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The device id to stop.

get.description: Turns a device off.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The device id to turn off.

get.description: Turns a device on.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The device id to turn on.

get.description: Send an "up" command to device.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The device id to send the command to.

get.description: Returns a list of all devices associated with the current user

parameters.name: extras
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned device. Currently supported fields are: coordinate, timezone and tzoffset

parameters.name: supportedMethods
parameters.description: The methods supported by the calling application

get.description: Adds a new group with devices and connects it to a client. The client must be editable for this to work. Please note that groups are devices as well. This means that all device/* commands will work for groups too.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The id of the client

parameters.name: devices
parameters.description: A comma separated string with the device ids this group should control

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the group

get.description: Removes a group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the group

get.description: Retrieves info about a specific job

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The job id

get.description: Lists all jobs. The list is sorted by nextRunTime. If nextRunTime is 0 it means the job will not be run at all.
Removes a job

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The job id to remove

get.description: Creates or updates a job. Set id to 0 if you want to create a new job. If you are creating a new job the deviceId must also be set. The deviceId can only be set upon creating a new job. When updating an existing job the deviceId parameter must be omitted.  Note! Only editable devices can be scheduled.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Is the job active or paused?

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The device id to schedule. Only valid when creating a new job

parameters.name: hour
parameters.description: A value between 0-23

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The job id, when updating an existing job

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: What to do when the schdule runs. This should be any of the method constants

parameters.name: methodValue
parameters.description: Only required for methods that requires this.

parameters.name: minute
parameters.description: A value between 0-59

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: This is only used when type is either 'sunrise' or 'sunset'

parameters.name: randomInterval
parameters.description: Number of minutes after the specified time to randomize.

parameters.name: reps
parameters.description: Number of times to resend the job to the client, for better reliability

parameters.name: retries
parameters.description: If the client is offline, this specifies the number of times to retry executing the job before consider the job as failed.

parameters.name: retryInterval
parameters.description: The number if minutes between retries. Example: If retries is 3 and retryInterval is 5 the scheduler will try executing the job every five minutes for fifteen minutes.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: This can be 'time', 'sunrise' or 'sunset'

parameters.name: weekdays
parameters.description: A comma separated list of weekdays. 1 is monday. Example: 2,3,4

get.description: Returns information about a specific sensor

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the sensor

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Mark a sensor as 'ignored'. Ignored sensors will not show up in sensors/list if not explicit set to do so.

parameters.name: ignore
parameters.description: 1 to igonre the sensor, 0 to inlude it again

get.description: Renames a sensor

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the sensor

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name

get.description: Returns a list of all sensors associated with the current user

parameters.name: includeIgnored
parameters.description: Set to 1 to include ignored sensors
